$Text2.#content: RBR uses widely-available “smart home” devices to manage the heating in your home. It comprises three parts:

$Text3.#content: - for each room to be controlled, a “room kit” monitors the temperature and controls the radiators in the room

$Text4.#content: - a matchbox-sized central controller looks after the system and connects by wifi to your Internet router

$Text5.#content: - a friendly user interface runs on any smartphone or computer

$Text6.#content: The system can be installed in a couple of hours, with no interruption to plumbing, electrics or Internet. It requires little management, but where adjustments are needed to the timing or temperatures, changes can be made locally by the home occupant or remotely, for example by a carer.

$Text7.#content: By monitoring room temperatures and only heating rooms that are in use, the RBR system can save up to 30% of the cost of heating compared to using a central thermostat. This allows the system to pay for itself, typically in its first year.
